caption: Notre-Dame-de-la-Croix de M√©nilmontant is a Roman Catholic parish church located at Place M√©nilmontant, in the 20th arrondissement of Paris, France.  It was built between 1863 and 1880. Of exceptional height and length, it is one of the largest churches in Paris.
Beautiful lesser-known church, tucked into the neighborhood of M√©nilmontant. Took me 8 years to find this gem.
I love this church. They have great masses twice a day on weekdays. I highly recommend.
Gorgeous. It is incredibly peaceful and accessible. Would recommend.
Peaceful space. Beautiful stained glass windows
Lovely church
Easy to find inside peace in the church
beautiful, especially the building from outside

Beautiful spot

Very original church and one of the largest in Paris: its floor space is larger than that of the Sacr√© Coeur basilica in Montmartre!  Its square is gigantic, with a very long flight of steps, so much so that films have been filmed there. Its vault is supported by aesthetic and original metal flying buttresses.  There are side entrances with fewer steps for people who have difficulty walking.  She is silent and prayerful. There are very beautiful paintings.  The priest is very welcoming.  I recommend

Rather sober and spacious church. I attended a wedding and really appreciated the organization. The priest said beautiful words, the person who recited had a very beautiful voice, it was quite captivating. There were plenty of places to sit. In addition, there were very beautiful paintings in the chapels. There are different entrances and the main entrance was raised, which would allow for elevated living. I took a few photos to share.

Very large church, I think it is the largest in Paris if we take into account the stairs which are part of the building. If you don't want to go up the stairs, you have to enter from the sides. The church is relaxing. I recommend it, to see once in your life.

1 wooden sculpture by Joseph Pyrz and a ceramic by L√©on Chedeville restored in 2020. Notre Dame de la Croix de M√©nilmontant also has an organ built in 1872 classified as a historic monument. A true Catholic nugget in the heart of the 20th century.
They are such lovely people. They are an example of how religious people or any human being should treat others.  This spirit heals the world. They truly embody the spirit of God.
It is a beautiful and impeccable church, far from tourism but worth visiting. Admission is free.
A beautiful church both inside and out. To visit
The Menilmontant lighthouse.  If the bell tower is open to the public, don't hesitate, I discovered some very beautiful frescoes there.

From the top of the steps, Notre-Dame de Lacroix illuminates the M√©nilmontant district with its architectural beauty. When the sun shines, the stained glass windows echo it to those who take the time to come and pray there, attend a mass or visit it.

Absolutely magnificent building! We attended a concert given by the Acad√©mie du Palais Royal and it was magnificent! The acoustics are excellent and the organ is fabulous! On the other hand, in the middle of winter, don't hesitate to wrap up well because this church is very large...
A magnificent church that not all Parisians know!
Just splendid

Superb Church, the nativity scene was placed this year in front of Notre Dame de la Croix, very good initiative The statue of St. Th√©r√®se which has also found its original place. Thanks to the Priests team.
Very beautiful church... welcoming and attentive priests. Our Lady of Lourdes is also present. Saint Joseph reigns over missing children...to light a candle in their memories.üôè ‚Ä¶

Large church in an unusual neighborhood... In my opinion the exterior is more beautiful than the interior because the stained glass windows are not very original and the interior decoration, even if there are beautiful painted frescoes, does not show such originality and beauty. that we can see in other Parisian churches! Now Faith has no need of rich finery and beautiful statues... On the side of the church, I could see a long line of "needy", men and women, young and old, waiting to receive food aid and that on the other hand is very good!!!

It is a very beautiful church which is located on several levels. You shouldn't have pain in your legs when you see all the steps you have to climb to enter through the main door. Fortunately, another door is located at the back of the building. The crypt is reserved for a neighborhood charity.

A church astonishing in its dimensions, located rue Julien Lacroix, between rue M√©nilmontant and rue des Couronnes. It is the 3rd largest church in Paris after Notre-Dame Cathedral and Saint-Sulpice Church. The interior is impressive. It's difficult to heat, the winters are cold. But it is worth visiting, if not praying there.

Our old parish. We celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary with Longeaux‚Äôs father. We participated in the February workshops with the fathers of Longeaux and Anglejan. Very good spiritual and friendly memories. We are now in Nazareth Parish. Paris 15th.

very beautiful church nestled in a very popular and lively area...to discover pretty stained glass windows and paintings. a surprising height or is it an optical effect due to the fact that it seems very narrow...

A big thank you to the volunteers of the Magalim√©nil association of Notre Dame de la Croix church. I was able to meet wonderful people there who always welcome you with big smiles regardless of your religion and race. As a Muslim, I thank you very much and hope to do the same one day. Thank you very much God bless you.

I stayed very close, across the street, I attended the Holy Hour and the Eucharist on my birthday, it was the best gift from the Lord to me, because being on a trip and spending that day without giving thanks for another year is life. It was impossible, I was only in Paris for 3 days and having the Church so close was the best thing about my trip through Europe üôèüèΩ‚ô•Ô∏è

Very beautiful church on the slope of the Mesnilmontant hill. The image of Mary suspended almost from the Cross with Magdalene behind and present is beautiful. I recommend praying in the small chapel of Saint Therese of Lisieux. The Spirit became present to me. A place of resource and peace. I don't know you need faith to admire and feel the Peace of the place. It is simply a place with bright and beautiful "energies".
